yutongz1997.auto2048.core

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • yutongz1997.auto2048.core.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The class of game engine, which provides fundamental but the most important elements (the game board, the moves, the scores, etc.) of the game.
    Author:
    Yutong Zhang

      • addNumber

        private void addNumber()

      • clone

        public Board clone()
        Deeply copies everything in the current game board, including all numbers and the scores of the player.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a copied board of the current one

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(int steps)
        Calculates the evaluation value, defined as the sum of following values, of the current game board:

        (a) the square of the scores of the board;

        (b) the square of the maximum number presented on the board;

        (c) a constant value 'WEIGHT_EMPTY' times the number of empty tiles;

        (d) the weights of all tiles.

        Parameters:
        steps - the steps taken up to now
        Returns:
        the evaluation value of the board

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        Returns the current game board as a two-dimension array.
        Returns:
        the game board

      • getEmptyTileNumber

        private int getEmptyTileNumber()
        Counts the number of empty tiles currently presented on the board.
        Returns:
        the number of empty tiles

      • getMaxTile

        public int getMaxTile()
        Determines the maximum number contained in all tiles currently presented on the board.
        Returns:
        the maximum number

      • getScores

        public int getScores()
        Returns the scores the player gets based on all tiles' information.
        Returns:
        the scores

      • getTileWeight

        private long getTileWeight(int row,
                           int column)
        Determines the weight of a tile at the given location. The weight is calculated as follows:

        (a) Corner tiles: a constant value 'WEIGHT_CORNER' times the number contained in the tile.

        (b) Side tiles (except corner ones): a constant value 'WEIGHT_SIDE' times the number contained in the tile.

        (c) Other tiles: a constant value 'WEIGHT_OTHER' times the number contained in the tile.

        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the tile
        column - the column index of the tile
        Returns:
        the weight of the given tile

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Determines whether the game is over based on the current tile distribution of the board. The game is NOT over if one of the five following conditions is satisfied:

        (a) There exists an empty tile.

        (b) The current tile and the one on its left contain the same number. (Since they can be combined and produce a larger one)

        (c) The current tile and the one on its right contain the same number.

        (d) The current tile and the one above it contain the same number.

        (e) The current tile and the one below it contain the same number.

        Returns:
        true if the game is over; false otherwise

      • isValidMove

        private boolean isValidMove(Board movedBoard)
        Determines if the game board actually moved after a move action. No matter what happens, first try moving it to get a new board, then compare it to the original one. If all elements of them are identical, the move is invalid (no actual move happened); valid otherwise.
        Parameters:
        movedBoard - the new board obtained by applying a move action to the original one
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid; false otherwise

      • move

        public Board move(CoreConstants.Directions direction)
        Obtains a new board by moving the current game board to the given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - the given direction
        Returns:
        the new board if the move is valid; null otherwise

      • moveDown

        private Board moveDown()
        Deeply copies the current board at first, then makes a down move on the cloned board and adds a new number.
        Returns:
        the final status of the board after moving down
